Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Procambarin (Gly-rich; antimicrobial protein; natural AMPs; Crustaceans, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: ovaries, antennal gland, intestine, gill, hepatopancreas, heart, haemocytes, red swamp crayfish,Procambarus clarkii

Literature Information.Literature: 56% glycines. Mol Wt: 13483.985; molecular formula:  C595H902N191O165S2; molar extinction coefficient:  18265. A potential antiviral effect is indicated by altered mRNA expression levels after viral challenge.
Literature Information.Author: Zeng Y.2013
Literature Information.Title: Procambarin: A glycine-rich peptide found in the haemocytes of red swamp crayfish Procambarus clarkii and its response to white spot syndrome virus challenge
